body_html:
@lantiga - I followed the same strategy at the functional level, too. See here, in particular, look at the way I wrote the constructor for the parent and child classes.

You have better tests in this PR that I do, frankly, so I should probably copy some of yours.
body_text:
@lantiga - I followed the same strategy at the functional level, too.  See here, in particular, look at the way I wrote the constructor for the parent and child classes.
You have better tests in this PR that I do, frankly, so I should probably copy some of yours.
body:
@lantiga - I followed the same strategy at the functional level, too.  See [here](https://github.com/andrewgiessel/pytorch/blob/1d026923bb90ca4ceff0ec78cd87dc2a1f4c2c25/torch/nn/_functions/thnn/upsampling.py#L11-L31), in particular, look at the way I wrote the constructor for the parent and child classes.

You have better tests in this PR that I do, frankly, so I should probably copy some of yours.
